This game is, by far, one of the best first person shooters I’ve ever played. It is a very early example of how games could tell a story without text boxes or scripts. While it does carry a lot of tropes for early FPS games like quick saves, and health packs, its eerie atmosphere and tense action easily make it one of the greatest games ever despite its lesser conclusion.

Kesinlikle tüm zamanların en abartılan oyunu. İnsanların ağzından düşmeyen bir oyun olması ister istemez yüksek bir beklentiyle giriş yapmanızı sağlıyor. Fakat oyunu oynayınca anlıyorsunuz ki genel olarak özet:
-Kutu sürükle,üstüne çıkar gidersin brom
-Npc var kesersin brom
-Boktan bir vanayı çevirirken bile buga girebilirsin o yüzden her adımda f6 spamlemeyi unutma brom.
Anlayamadığım nokta şu. İnsanlara bu oyunun iyi olduğunu düşündüren ne?
-Sağlam,gerici bir atmosferi var mı? -Arada ışıklar yanıp sönüyor bir de yaratıklar bağırıyor aptalsan korkarsın.
-Güzel bir hikayesi var mı? -Güzeli bırak hikayesi bile yok.
-Yapay zeka? -Tetrisle kapışır.
-Vuruş hissiyatı var mı? -Yarrak var.
Oyuna giriş yaptığınız an ile birkaç saat sonrasının en ufak bir farkı yok. Size hiçbir zaman yeni bir şey sunamıyor. Sürekli npc kesiyorsunuz. E iyi hoş npc keselim fakat 0 vuruş hissiyatının olduğu bir oyunda bu ne kadar sıkmadan devam edebilir ki? Yaratıkların birbirinden farkları; 2 vuruşta ölenler 10 vuruşta ölenler 20 vuruşta ölenler... Bir süre sonra mermilerinizi dikkatli kullanmaya, temkinli hareket etmeye başlıyorsunuz evet. Peki merminiz bitince noluyor? Çoğu zaman koşarak ekebiliyorsunuz çünkü yapay zeka diye bir şey yok.
zor bir oyun mu? evet zor bir oyun fakat iyi anlamda zor değil. sadece gereksizce uğraştırıcı. çünkü zorluğu beyninizi kullanmanız gereken bölüm tasarımlarından ziyade daha fazla ve daha zor ölen yaratıklar gibi temellere dayanıyor. Peki oyunun bu kadar uğraşa değen bir sonu var mı? kesinlikle yok. Uzun ve boktan bir boss fight dan sonra G-man size ''Helal olsun Freeman. Şimdi ya bir sonraki görev için bana katılırsın ya da dizlerinin üstüne çöküp bana temizinden bir blowjob yaparsın'' diyor.

Kısacası insanların anlaması gereken şu:
Half-life'ın zamanında iyi bir oyun olması onu iyi bir oyun yapmaz. Onu zamanında iyi bir oyun yapar.

Has a great story and old graphics that you'll either love or hate. It is a really fun game and is fun just trying to take as little damage as you can as you progress through the levels. The few things I disliked was the boss fight at the end and the chapter 'on a rail' but other than that it's a really fun classic. My rating: 9/10

I'm glad I finally decided to try this game before I'll continue with Half Life 2.
And I already enjoyed it more than it's successor.

If you're looking for a challenging FPS this game is for you. But Hard can get really cheap sometimes, and the amount of bullets an human enemy can take is kinda confusing at the start. I only realized how to kill them when I started Blue Shift.
And the last few chapters are a real challenge, but it's an accomplishment if you manage to deal with it.

Anyways, you're missing out on a great game.

(fuck the final boss though)

Half-Life is deservedly regarded as being one of the very best games ever made. The AI holds up impressively well. The weapons, enemies and set pieces are all spectacular. The gunplay is strategic and polished. A robust and active modding scene provides infinite replay value. I adore Half-Life with every ounce of my soul.

The first Half life I've played is opposing force and I love it. So is Half life good as opposing force? Yes but gordon freeman is boring for me.  Adrian Shephard I liked cause a little personally was more then enough for me to like him (Even when he did have the same of being quiet as gordon freeman, but the way the game was setup was enough to tell me what he is feeling and thinking through out the game.) but not gordon freeman. Hell aiden pearce had more personally then gordon freeman. Look the game is fun and aiden pearce gives me the feeling of someone locking all feelings away to control himself better. you can agree or not, it's fine but gordon freeman I don't feel anything with him. Adrian Shephard and aiden pearce gave me something at least. It may have to do with that I like silent hill a lot and hotline miami those games is where you can get a lot of personally of hate, pain, sadness, and fears in everything in the games within by slowly looking at it carefully. Gordon freeman I don't feel anything and I was looking carefully and found nothing. he's fun but needs a little, just little personally. 

As for the gameplay and story it's great. It's a blast, crazy and more feels more real then any gun fights I've ever been in a game before. Wanting to find a way out and get the hell out of there.

good game

First play through from beginning to end was on hard mode which I really don't recommend for people who aren't willing to replay the same section a dozen times over until you know exactly which enemies are where and figuring out the best way to deal with them and repeating that process throughout nearly every section of the game, which sounds like a bit of a pain in the ass but turned out to be surprisingly fun having to come up with new strategies upon every respawn and feeling a great sense of accomplishment every time you finally beat it, the puzzles were challenging but not too hard which is always nice in any game and the narrative story was exciting to piece together most of which was by judging what was happening around you and the occasional tidbit of info you'd get from the npc's but still left a lot to the imagination, with my favorite part being (SPOILERS) ease dropping on a couple of soldiers and finding out the reason the military is hunting you down specifically in the later parts of the game was they thought freeman sabotaged the facility and purposely caused the alien invasion.

To wrap things up I think the game was great and holds up excellently despite being older then I am, I think anybody who plays it will love exploring the ever changing world and fighting your way through a multitude of different enemies with a gigantic arsenal of varying guns and piecing together an interesting story in the process.

First time Half-Life 1 player here. 

PROS:
- Level design in this game is truly outstanding. Many modern games should take note. 
- Gameplay is fun even after so many years.
- The pacing is great. The game managed to engage and surprise me with each new level. I was never bored.
- [spoiler]Loved the final boss fight and the finale. It had an almost psychedelic/dream-like feeling to it.[/spoiler]
- Despite being dated in visuals and audio the game is still able to create very atmospheric and suspenseful moments, because the excellent art direction itself compensates for the aged technology the game is built on.

CONS:
- Occasional bugs where you get stuck in the geometry but since I quick-save regularly it isn't a game breaking issue for me.
- NPCs have path-finding issues.

VERDICT:
Recommended.

[b]Is the game overrated?[/b]: Totally, [spoiler]Like alot of old school shooters[/spoiler]
[b]Is this game bad?[/b]: Far from it, its honestly really good and aged surprisingly well [spoiler]Like alot of old school shooters[/spoiler]

Not to undermine it's legacy, but what made Half-Life special in 1998 has been done better in other games since, that being a story driven game. But its also one that remembers to be an actual game too, and it's the game part that is incredibly put together still makes it worth it to play even now, even when the gameplay elements are just simple stuff by today's standards. 

You are a scientist named Gordon Freeman, who was working on an experiment that goes bad and aliens start attacking. The story is basic, even at the time and it dosen't get fleshed out until later in the series, but how it's told complements the pacing and gameplay, never has it worked against it.

The gameplay is where the game still shines. again it's stuff we see in shooters today but the pacing and level design gives us an incredibly well polished game. The game dosen't play all of its cards from the get go, it introduces gameplay mechanics organically as the game goes. You have a well rounded arsenal of weapons, but each one has a niche role. Like you can use the SMG at close or medium range, but the spread means that anything beyond medium rage is wasting ammo. This isn't a bad thing by any means but it's something to keep in mind. The only real issues I have with the gameplay is that there are some parts of the game where its just guesswork, but its few and far in between all this well polished gameplay.

The AI can be both incredibly stupid and brilliant at the same time. Like the aliens can be eating your corpse when they kill you or explore the environment or other little things that help cement the idea that these are animals not fodder for your guns. At the same time they have some of the more crappy pathfinding I have seen in a game. This is ten times worse with your allies cause it feels more like babysitting.

Some older FPS fan might point their fingers at Half-Life as to why we have FPS campaigns that focus too much on story and not enough on gameplay, but I think it's that alot of developers nowadays copy what Half-Life did without thinking about HOW Half-Life did it and how they made it work. Careful craftsmanship is what make games, not the gameplay elements, and I think Half-Life is a great example of it.

Um clássico que envelheceu muito bem com o tempo. Sem palavras para esse jogo fenomenal, entre facilmente na lista de melhores jogos que eu já joguei, possui um universo muito rico, além de um enredo fantástico e um clima que faz com que o jogador se sinta na pele de Gordon Freeman. Sem dúvida alguma, um verdadeiro clássico.
